009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel2D;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Scalar (non-separable) version of the Bilateral filter as proposed in [1].
021 * On color images, this filter is applied separately to each color component.
022 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
023 * image types. See Sec. 17.2 of [2] for additional details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
027 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
028 * Bombay, India.
029 * <br>
030 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
031 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2021/01/01
036 */
037public class BilateralFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements BilateralF {
038        
039        private final float[][] Hd;     // the domain kernel
040        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
041        private final double sigmaR2;
042        
043        public BilateralFilterScalar() {
044                this(new Parameters());
045        }
046        
047        public BilateralFilterScalar(Parameters params) {
048                GaussianKernel2D kernel = new GaussianKernel2D(params.sigmaD);
049                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
050                this.K = kernel.getXc();
051                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
052        }
053        
054        @Override
055        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
056                float S = 0;                    // sum of weighted pixel values
057                float W = 0;                    // sum of weights               
058                final float a = plane.getVal(u, v); // value of the current center pixel
059                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
060                        for (int n = -K; n <= K; n++) {
061                                float b = plane.getVal(u + m, v + n);
062                                float wd = Hd[m + K][n + K];            // domain weight
063                                float wr = gauss(a - b, sigmaR2);       // range weight
064                                float w = wd * wr;
065                                S = S + w * b;
066                                W = W + w;
067                        }
068                }
069                return S / W;
070        }
071        
072        private float gauss(double x, double sigma2) {
073                return (float) Math.exp(-(x * x) / (2 * sigma2));
074        }
075
076}
